regions.text:
Supplementary Information The online version contains supplemen-
tary material available at https://doi.org/10.1007/s12072-022-10321-y.

regions.crop_image_path: /mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Deep learning for prediction of hepatocellular carcinoma recurrence after resection or liver transplanatation/crops_ordered/page_11/region_03_text.png
regions.text:
Author contributions LZ, ZS and XX designed the study. ZW, HY,
WJw, WJg had full access to all the data. HY, LZ and LY analyzed the
data, wrote the manuscript, and were responsible for the decision to
submit the manuscript. All authors provided substantial comments on
drafts and approved the final report.

regions.crop_image_path: /mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Deep learning for prediction of hepatocellular carcinoma recurrence after resection or liver transplanatation/crops_ordered/page_11/region_04_text.png
regions.text:
Funding This research gained support from the Key Program
of Provincial Natural Foundation of Zhejiang Province (No.
LZ22H18003), Key Research & Development Plan of Zhejiang Prov-
ince (No. 2019C03050, No.2022C03108, No. 2021C03118) and the
National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 92159202, No.
81930016, No. 81802889). Research results are partially based on data
from the TCGA database.

Availability of dataand material The data that support the findings of this
study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request.

Conflict of interest Zhikun Liu, Yuanpeng Liu, Wenhui Zhang, Yuan
Hong, Jinwen Meng, Jianguo Wang, Shusen Zheng and Xiao Xu have
nothing to disclose.

of the First Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine.
